channel.title: Pokemon Showdown
channel.description:
Competitive Pokemon Simulation, complete with (almost) all animations.
Check it out here and tell me what you think: http://pokemonshowdown.com/

item.title: Pokemon Showdown
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Here’s my OU team:

Sigilyph @ Flame Orb
Trait: Magic Guard
EVs: 252 HP / 56 Spd / 200 Def
Bold Nature

  • Cosmic Power
  • Stored Power
  • Roost
  • Psycho Shift

Haxorus @ Lum Berry
Trait: Mold Breaker
EVs: 36 HP / 252 Atk / 220 Spd
Adamant Nature

  • Dragon Dance
  • Swords Dance
  • Outrage
  • Earthquake

Magnezone @ Leftovers
Trait: Magnet Pull
Shiny: Yes
EVs: 252 SAtk / 248 HP / 8 SDef
Modest Nature
IVs: 30 Atk / 30 SAtk / 0 Spd

  • Substitute
  • Thunderbolt
  • Hidden Power [Fire]
  • Charge Beam

Reuniclus @ Life Orb
Trait: Magic Guard
EVs: 192 HP / 64 Def / 252 SAtk
Quiet Nature
IVs: 0 Spd

  • Trick Room
  • Psychic
  • Focus Blast
  • Shadow Ball

Infernape @ Life Orb
Trait: Blaze
Shiny: Yes
EVs: 252 Spd / 252 Atk / 4 SAtk
Hasty Nature

  • Overheat
  • Close Combat
  • Grass Knot
  • Stone Edge

Salamence @ Life Orb
Trait: Intimidate
EVs: 252 Spd / 252 Atk / 4 SAtk
Naughty Nature

  • Dragon Dance
  • Outrage
  • Earthquake
  • Fire Blast

Another one:

Dragonite @ Leftovers
Trait: Multiscale
EVs: 252 HP / 64 Def / 60 SDef / 132 Spd
Jolly Nature

  • Dragon Dance
  • Dragon Claw
  • Roost
  • Substitute

Starmie @ Leftovers
Trait: Natural Cure
EVs: 252 HP / 252 Spd / 4 SAtk
Timid Nature

  • Scald
  • Ice Beam
  • Rapid Spin
  • Recover

Breloom @ Toxic Orb
Trait: Poison Heal
EVs: 12 HP / 244 Atk / 252 Spd
Adamant Nature

  • Spore
  • Substitute
  • Focus Punch
  • Stone Edge

Landorus (M) @ Expert Belt
Trait: Sand Force
EVs: 228 Atk / 28 SAtk / 252 Spd
Naive Nature

  • Earthquake
  • Stone Edge
  • U-turn
  • Hidden Power [Ice]

Tyranitar @ Leftovers
Trait: Sand Stream
EVs: 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 SDef
Careful Nature

  • Stealth Rock
  • Pursuit
  • Crunch
  • Superpower

Amoonguss @ Black Sludge
Trait: Regenerator
EVs: 252 HP / 28 SAtk / 228 SDef
Calm Nature

  • Spore
  • Giga Drain
  • Hidden Power [Ice]
  • Clear Smog

And here’s my uber team:

Deoxys-Attack @ Focus Sash
Trait: Pressure
EVs: 252 Spd / 252 Atk / 4 SAtk
Hasty Nature

  • Psycho Boost
  • Superpower
  • ExtremeSpeed
  • Shadow Ball

Zekrom @ Choice Band
Trait: Teravolt
EVs: 252 Atk / 252 HP / 4 SAtk
Naughty Nature

  • Bolt Strike
  • Dragon Claw
  • Outrage
  • Volt Switch

Palkia @ Lustrous Orb
Trait: Pressure
EVs: 252 Spd / 252 SAtk / 4 Atk
Hasty Nature

  • Surf
  • Spacial Rend
  • Outrage
  • Thunder

Kyurem-White @ Choice Specs
Trait: Turboblaze
EVs: 252 SAtk / 252 HP / 4 SDef
Modest Nature

  • Draco Meteor
  • Ice Beam
  • Focus Blast
  • Earth Power

Lugia @ Leftovers
Trait: Pressure
EVs: 252 HP / 176 Def / 80 SDef
Impish Nature

  • Roost
  • Substitute
  • Dragon Tail
  • Earthquake

Wobbuffet @ Leftovers
Trait: Shadow Tag
EVs: 28 HP / 228 Def / 252 SDef

  • Counter
  • Mirror Coat
  • Encore
  • Safeguard

And my R/B/Y team:

Exeggutor (M) @ (No Item)

  • Sleep Powder
  • Mega Drain
  • Explosion
  • Psychic

Starmie @ (No Item)

  • Thunderbolt
  • Ice Beam
  • Recover
  • Thunder Wave

Chansey (F) @ (No Item)

  • Softboiled
  • Thunder Wave
  • Thunderbolt
  • Ice Beam

Alakazam (M) @ (No Item)

  • Substitute
  • Psychic
  • Seismic Toss
  • Recover

Tauros (M) @ (No Item)

  • Body Slam
  • Earthquake
  • Blizzard
  • Substitute

Gengar (M) @ (No Item)

  • Thunderbolt
  • Explosion
  • Night Shade
  • Hypnosis

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Showdown
item.dc:creator: @Pink_Phat Pink Phat
item.description:
@Pink_Phat wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:16, topic:471574”][quote author=Pink Phat link=topic=589184.msg4177494#msg4177494 date=1355152450]

Can we talk about how sad the new generation of Pokemon designs make me?

I know… I tried one of the newer Pokemon games on an Emulator and it was awful.

It’s just not the same.

I prefer the newer games. Would play them over the old games any day. Here are a few reasons why:

  • The psychical\special split. (This meant that types would not decide if a move was special or not)
  • Much more content.
  • Much more stuff to do after you beat the elite 4.
  • Swarms

Those are just a few reasons why.
[/quote]

Wait, so the Type doesn’t decide a Super Effective move anymore? That was the whole premise upon which Combat was designed around…[/quote]
I think you read over what I wrote a bit too quickly.

The psychical\special split does not effect if a move is super effective or not. What I meant is, the type of a move does not decide if a move is psychical or special. This is better, as before the split moves like fire punch were special (which made no sense at all as a punching attack should be psychical.) Do you understand now?

Read full topic

@kronixz wrote:

Ah I miss the old days of the pokemon shows from 99-02 they were always the best. All the new ones are stupid. They always seemed to amaze me since I was a little child. ,y favorite one is when ask, Brock, and mistie get caught in a snowstorm and build heir own in mountain cave, and they find a spring. <3
sorry for getting off-topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Showdown
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:16, topic:471574”][quote author=Pink Phat link=topic=589184.msg4177494#msg4177494 date=1355152450]

Can we talk about how sad the new generation of Pokemon designs make me?

I know… I tried one of the newer Pokemon games on an Emulator and it was awful.

It’s just not the same.

I prefer the newer games. Would play them over the old games any day. Here are a few reasons why:

  • The psychical\special split. (This meant that types would not decide if a move was special or not)
  • Much more content.
  • Much more stuff to do after you beat the elite 4.
  • Swarms

Those are just a few reasons why.
[/quote]

Wait, so the Type doesn’t decide a Super Effective move anymore? That was the whole premise upon which Combat was designed around…[/quote]

No, he’s just talking about the difference between the Defense and Special Defense stats and the difference between moves and their properties.

Where attacks like Fire Blast are a special attack with a POW of 120 and a pokemon who’s used Nasty Plot (x2 Spec. A) or Calm Mind (x1.5 Spec. A and Spec. D), upping the POW of Fire Blast to 180 or 240.

If you check any of the new pokemon games, you will see an icon which separates the two types of moves.
Special
Physical

Unfortunately, I couldn’t find any better images to describe it.

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Showdown
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:12, topic:471574”]Prepare for trouble!

Make it double!

To protect the world from devastation!

To unite all peoples within our nation!

To denounce the evils of truth and love!

To extend our reach to the stars above!

Jessie!

James!

Team Rocket, blast off at the speed of light!

Surrender now, or prepare to fight!

MEOWTH: Meowth! That’s right!

[size=18pt]All of your Pokemon are mine.[/size][/quote]

ahh memories

Can we talk about how sad the new generation of Pokemon designs make me?

I know… I tried one of the newer Pokemon games on an Emulator and it was awful.

It’s just not the same.
[/quote]
I prefer the newer games. Would play them over the old games any day. Here are a few reasons why:

  • The psychical\special split. (This meant that types would not decide if a move was special or not)
  • Much more content.
  • Much more stuff to do after you beat the elite 4.

Those are just a few reasons why.[/quote]

Those are just a few reasons why.

item.title: Pokemon Showdown
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

The new pokemon designs have me saddened as well but you have to get used to them in order to play competitively, which is fun in my case. I ended up getting sort of good in random battles. You gotta predict what kind of pokemon he might have, along with their movesets and the type of items they carry. Items can make or break a team depending on how you use them.

Ex: Switcharoo/Trick a Choice Scarf/Band onto a pokemon using Thunder Wave, forcing them to switch out.

Read full topic
